Unnamed: 4: Ratio of technical customer requirements accepted

Unnamed: 5: Benefit: Early indicator for the Project to know how many L1 requirements are committed & planned for a release

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of system interfaces successfully verified
Ratio of system requirements successfully verified

Unnamed: 5: Possible root cause: Either the edit state is not equal to ACCEPTED or IRM LCS is not equal to Implemented or Qualified

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of software interfaces successfully verified
Ratio of software requirements successfully verified
Ratio of SSL requirements successfully verified (only safety in 2017!)

Unnamed: 5: Benefit: To know the status of the planned CRQ for a release

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of technical customer requirements traceable to internal requirements

Unnamed: 5: Possible root cause: For Requirements developed with old templates Maturity not equal to READY FOR IMPLEMENTATION. For Requirements developed with current templates Edit state not equal to ACCEPTED or REVIEW_END or DELETED. Check the RQ1 - DOORS coupling for the requirement

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of system requirements traceable to its source

Unnamed: 5:
Benefit: Link from lower level requirements (L2,L3 and L4) to higher level L1 requirement (Customer / Platform) are completely traceable. 
             Will be useful later during testing phase for better understanding of the requirements

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of system requirements linked to at least one test case

Unnamed: 5: Benefit: Early indicator for the Project / Function Development to make sure that the test cases are available (front loading)

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of defined system interfaces linked to at least one test case

Unnamed: 5: Possible root cause: For Requirements developed with old templates Maturity not equal to READY FOR IMPLEMENTATION. For Requirements developed with current templates Edit state not equal to ACCEPTED or REVIEW_END or DELETED. Check the RQ1 - DOORS coupling for the requirement

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of software requirements traceable to its source

Unnamed: 5:
Benefit: Link from lower level requirement L4 to higher level L1 requirement (Customer / Platform) or L2 or L3 are completely traceable. 
             Will be useful later during testing phase for better understanding of the requirements

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of software requirements linked to at least one test case

Unnamed: 5: Benefit: Early indicator for the Project / Function Development to make sure that the test cases are available (front loading)

Unnamed: 4: Ratio of software interfaces linked to at least one test case
Ratio of software units implemented or changed according to current release plan
Ratio of software components/units successfully verified

At PS-EC this metric shall be deleted. if not requested by customer because check is done in SMART DB

Unnamed: 4: Sum of unevaluated errors and warnings from static code analysis

Unnamed: 5: Not or wrong accessed MISRA warnings are present
Benefit: Gives a quick overview to the Project / P-Res about the unassessed warnings/errros for the selected releases (BC or PVER)

Unnamed: 4: Number of software units/components (FCs) with BMI <= -50

Unnamed: 5: Benefit: Early indicator to the Project before QG4 to know how many complex functions (Safety, Legislation,…) are still unassessed
